thread.title: Auburn expects injured Montravius Adams, Roc Thomas to play against Arkansas
thread.title_full: Auburn expects injured Montravius Adams, Roc Thomas to play against Arkansas

author: James Crepea | jcrepea@al.com
title: Auburn expects injured Montravius Adams, Roc Thomas to play against Arkansas
text:
Comments 
A pair of injured Auburn players is expected to play in Saturday's game at Arkansas. 
Defensive tackle Montravius Adams and running back Roc Thomas both suffered undisclosed injuries during Auburn's 30-27 win at Kentucky last week but are expected to be on the field Saturday in Fayetteville. 
"They both practiced Sunday and we expect them to play," Auburn coach Gus Malzahn said. 
RELATED: Roc Thomas fighting 'nagging' injury 
Thomas, who suffered a leg injury against Louisville and foot injury against Mississippi State, is believed to be dealing with another leg injury. 
He started against the Wildcats but had four rushes for just eight yards. The sophomore has 33 carries for 157 yards with eight catches for 163 yards and one touchdown this season. 
Adams recorded two tackles against Kentucky and 22 tackles for the season. Auburn head coach Gus Malzahn: Oct. 20, 2015 Auburn head coach Gus Malzahn talks to the press during the weekly press conference Tuesday, Oct. 20, 2015, in Auburn, Ala. (Julie Bennett/jbennett@al.com)
